text: Stepping Out is the debut album by Canadian jazz pianist and vocalist Diana Krall, released in 1993. It has since been reissued several times on Justin Time Records, as Stepping Out: The Early Recordings on GRP Records, and as a vinyl LP record through Barnes & Noble. ==Track listing== Sources = #"This Can't Be Love" (Richard Rodgers, Lorenz Hart) - 4:31 #"Straighten Up and Fly Right" (Nat King Cole, Irving Mills) - 3:56 #"Between the Devil and the Deep Blue Sea" (Harold Arlen, Ted Koehler) - 4:04 #"I'm Just a Lucky So-and-So" (Duke Ellington, Mack David) - 4:23 #"Body and Soul" (Johnny Green, Frank Eyton, Edward Heyman, Robert Sour) - 5:35 #"42nd Street" (Harry Warren, Al Dubin) - 6:21 #"Do Nothing till You Hear from Me" (Duke Ellington, Bob Russell) - 4:33 #"Big Foot" (Klaus Suonsaari) - 7:07 #"The Frim-Fram Sauce" (Joe Ricardel, Redd Evans) - 4:08 #"Jimmie" (Diana Krall) - 5:26 #"As Long as I Live" (Harold Arlen, Ted Koehler) - 4:42 #"On the Sunny Side of the Street" (Jimmy McHugh, Dorothy Fields) - 4:51 ==Personnel== Sources = *Diana Krall - piano, vocals *John Clayton - acoustic bass *Jeff Hamilton - drums *Producer: Jim West *Engineer: Hank Cicalo, Ian Terry, Rick Winquest *Mixing: Denis Cadieux, Ian Terry *Mastering: Ian Terry *Remastering: Renée Marc-Aurèle *Arranger: Diana Krall *Photography: Les Paparazzi, Michael Slobodian *Liner notes: Ray Brown ==Charts== Album - Billboard (North America) {| border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=2 width="550px" !align="left"|Year !align="left"|Chart !align="left"|Position |- |align="left"|2000 |align="left"|Top Jazz Albums |align="left"|3 |- |} ==Certifications== {| class="wikitable" !align="left"|Country !align="left"|Certification !align="left"|Sales/shipments |- | Canada | Gold | 40,000 |- |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Diana Krall albums Category:1993 debut albums Category:Covers albums Category:Justin Time Records albums
